Big Three, the.translation[0].definition: General Motors, Ford, and Chrysler, which are the three largest American car makers
The Big Three have all announced incentives to boost flagging auto sales.
Big Three, the.translation[1].definition: the largest US car makers: General Motors, Ford, and Chrysler, especially before Chrysler and Daimler-Benz joined together in 1998
The Big Three have lost much of the passenger car market to the Japanese and others.
